intro: Acleisanthes nevadensis, commonly known as the Sierra whiteflower, is a flowering plant native to the Sierra Nevada mountain range in California. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its small, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky habitats and open woodlands, often at high elevations. It has slender, branching stems and narrow, linear leaves. Acleisanthes nevadensis is a rare and endangered species, with limited geographic distribution and specific ecological requirements.
